intro: Mattiastrum, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to South America, particularly the Andean regions. These plants are characterized by their showy yellow or orange composite flowers and are often found in moist, temperate environments. Mattiastrum species typically have basal leaves that are alternate and sometimes hairy. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
